Title: Qatari intersections with global genetics research and discourse
Abstract: © 2017 Informa UK Limited, trading as Taylor & Francis Group.Genetic discourses have taken a predominant role in approaches to combating a number of conditions that affect Qataris. This paper is derived from an exploration of Qatari encounters with globalizing discourses of genetics, particularly as they relate to notions of risk. It explores Qataris negotiations of global interactions and influences, including the discourses around genetic risk and cousin marriage. It suggests that family marriage can be seen as one of the main platforms of resistance and a means for modern, cosmopolitan and tradition to be negotiated.
SubjectAreas: Public Health, Environmental and Occupational Health
